column4: Can someone help recover jaunty login. Only shell login is possible now?
what did you do?
Tried installing WIne. It complained of dependencies & tried to fix. libxrender*
in console type "sudo init 1"
and then select "xfix"
removed libxrender while trying to install Wine
then install libxrender
by the way, installing wine was supposed to be a straight forward process, did you compile it from source?
first ran ./configure and kept checking its dependency requrements. Thats when it became a prob
why you didnt use synaptic instead?
anyway just try installing your libxrender
try "sudo apt-cache search libxrender" first
then "sudo apt-get install <app_name>"
synaptic was the 1st thing i tried to install libxrender. It installed it but Wine did not work.
do you want wine or to log in to your machine?
did you fix your GUI login now?
after that i did apt-cache ....  and followed by install. It also installed it but wine kept complaining about deps
you should remove for now
right now desperate to get desktop back
sudo apt-get remove wine
then "sudo apt-get install <your app name>"
thats 1st step im dong now.
i have to go now, good luck.
will remove and continue with librender install. Booting out of vista to go in jaunty. Thanks
